summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff and FBI case agents, coordinating the finalization and distribution of victim notification letters in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It includes an attached updated victim list and discusses verifying contact information for several victims.

persons.name: Victim-Witness Assistant
persons.context: A staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) who is managing the victim notification list and correspondence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York involved in the Epstein case, requesting the victim list for review and coordination of notifications.

connections.description: They are colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, collaborating on victim notification procedures for the Epstein case.

events.title: Finalization of Victim Notification Letters
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI case agents coordinate to finalize and send out victim notification letters, using an updated victim list attached to the email.

events.title: Request for Victim Contact Information
events.description: Prosecutors note missing contact information for several victims on the list and discuss coordinating with FBI case agents to obtain it.

events.title: Compilation and Review of Victim List
events.description: The Victim-Witness Assistant sends an initial victim list pulled from the Victim Notification System (VNS) to prosecutors for review and correction.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively managing a victim notification list for the Jeffrey Epstein case in July 2019.
An updated victim list was attached as an Excel file ('US_v. jpsteins _Updated_Victim_List.xlsx'), indicating an ongoing effort to identify and contact victims.
The correspondence reveals coordination between prosecutors and FBI case agents to verify and obtain contact information for victims, with some victims having opted out of notifications.
The urgency to send out letters was driven by an upcoming court conference the following week.
The document highlights procedural steps in victim notification, including checking the Victim Notification System (VNS) and corresponding with victims' attorneys.
